Key Match Events: Zaman and Babar played magnificently to keep Pakistan in the hunt after New Zealand posted a staggering 401 runs.
Zaman hit an unbeaten 126 off 81 balls, leading Pakistan to victory by 21 runs using D/L method.
Post-Match Reflections: Captain Babar Azam said, 'All credit goes to Fakhar, we planned to built partnership, I just tried to give maximum strike to Fakhar, We knew we can utilize short boundaries'
New Zealand captain Kane Williamson said, 'The ground wasn't big enough for Fakhar Zaman, and he played an exceptional knock. [We] just need to take the positives into the next match.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan won by 21 runs (DLS method) and moved level with New Zealand on eight points in the World Cup table.
Zaman hit a fiery ton in Bengaluru, one of his best innings.
Pakistan will need some other results to go in their favour if they are to sneak into a semifinal spot.
